api-reference/pipe.title: Pipe API Reference
api-reference/pipe.description: This page provides detailed information about the Pipe Protocol API.

core-concepts/hooks.title: Hooks
core-concepts/hooks.description: Hooks in Pipe Protocol provide a way to extend and customize the behavior of data processing. They allow you to execute custom logic before and after data is stored in IPFS.

core-concepts/records-and-bundles.title: Records and Bundles
core-concepts/records-and-bundles.description: Pipe Protocol uses two main data structures for managing content: Records and Bundles. Understanding these structures is crucial for working with Pipe effectively.

core-concepts/scopes.title: Scopes
core-concepts/scopes.description: Scopes in Pipe Protocol determine how data is stored, accessed, and replicated across different contexts. Understanding scopes is crucial for managing data visibility and access control.

core-concepts/tool-wrapping.title: Tool Wrapping
core-concepts/tool-wrapping.description: Tool wrapping is a core concept in Pipe Protocol that enables existing tools to work with IPFS storage. When you wrap a tool, you enhance it with additional capabilities while preserving its original functionality.

getting-started/installation.title: Installation
getting-started/installation.description: Getting started with Pipe Protocol is straightforward. Follow these steps to install and set up the protocol in your project.

guides/basic-usage.title: Basic Usage
guides/basic-usage.description: This guide will walk you through the basic usage of Pipe Protocol, showing you how to wrap tools and interact with the IPFS storage.
